{"step_by_step_thinking": "Hyalinization in orthodontic movement refers to a cell free zone histologically similar to hyaline appearance. This means that during orthodontic tooth movement, there is a formation of an area in the periodontal ligament that lacks cells and appears hyaline-like. This hyalinization is considered an undesirable side-effect of orthodontic tooth movement.", "answer_choice": "A"}
